title: Reflection ‚Äî LLM Use (300‚Äì500 words)
text:
Date: 2025-10-22
Model(s): ChatGPT (LLM)
What worked better as I added pages.
Expanding to a multi-page structure clarified what belongs on each page and reduced cognitive load on the reader. The navbar gave me a stable mental model‚ÄîHome for quick context, Resume for depth, Projects for evidence, Skills/Certs for proof, and Contact for calls-to-action. Using an LLM helped me brainstorm section labels, write first drafts fast, and surface alternative phrasings. The biggest win was idea-generation and rewording; it saved time and helped me keep a consistent tone across pages.
Ensuring authenticity and accuracy.
I treated the LLM‚Äôs output as a starting point, never as the source of truth. I replaced general phrasing with my real data: titles, dates, responsibilities, and the exact tools I used. I verified every claim against my resume and coursework, removed anything that sounded generic or unearned, and added context from my own experience‚Äîespecially metrics and outcomes where I had them. I also included an Appendix that stores the prompts and the unedited LLM drafts to make the AI contribution transparent.
What I‚Äôd improve next.
I will add richer evidence (links to PDFs, brief case write-ups), collect concrete metrics for my highlights, and refine accessibility (alt text, heading order, contrast). I also plan to experiment with another theme and add a simple site search. Overall, the multi-page site feels more professional and scannable; the LLM is most helpful for brainstorming and polishing, while accuracy and voice are my responsibility.

title: Home
text:
MBA Candidate ¬∑ University Canada West (UCW) ¬∑ Vancouver, BC


I have a degree in people-oriented industrial psychology, with experience in  human resources , mainly in the compensation and benefits  department, recruitment, and onboarding processes. I am currently developing my culinary  skills in Vancouver, British Columbia. I define myself by always prioritizing customer service, prioritizing clarity and reliability in processes, thereby positively transforming the decisions that can be made to have a positive impact on the future of companies and their operations.


View Resume View Projects Appendix

title: Home
text:
Highlights

More than 3 years of experience in Human Resources at Shell Dominican Republic, serving employees, internal and external clients, managing internal documentation, and creating monthly metrics.
Practices in the culinary field that require high speed, focused on organization, teamwork, and the preparation of food dishes with high quality standards.

title: Appendix ‚Äî LLM Site Map & Drafts
text:
D. What I kept vs.¬†changed

Kept: Page structure, concise bullet style, CTA buttons.

Modified: Replaced generic wording with my real timeline, roles, and tools; polished tone.

Removed: Unverified claims and filler text.

Added: Links to resume PDF and project artifacts; accessibility tweaks.

title: Projects / Case Studies
text:
Below are selected projects. Each includes a short overview, my role, and outcomes.



TriMetrix ‚Üí Career Pathways


Overview: Used DISC, Driving Forces, and Competencies to align roles and development paths.


Role: Analyst and presenter.


Outcome: Clear role-fit insights and a learning plan mapped to goals.




Odyssey Life Design (ILDP)


Overview: Multi-year plan with SMART metrics and 70-20-10 activities.


Role: Author ‚Äî designed alternatives, risks, and milestones.


Outcome: Actionable roadmap and reflection framework.




Marketing & Analytics Coursework


Overview: Quarto reports, strategy memos, and simple dashboards for class cases.


Role: Analyst and writer.


Outcome: Clear communication of findings; reproducible reports in Markdown.
